meanings.definition: To stay longer than expected or desired.
meanings.sent1: She kept outstaying at the party, not realizing it was time to leave.
meanings.sent2: He tends to outstay his welcome at gatherings, making people uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The cat outstayed on the windowsill, refusing to come inside even when called.
meanings.sent4: The sun outstaying its welcome in the sky, delaying the onset of night.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies outstaying in the kitchen, tempting everyone to indulge.

meanings.definition: To remain in a place beyond the usual or expected time.
meanings.sent1: The tourists outstayed at the museum, fascinated by the exhibits.
meanings.sent2: After the movie ended, they outstayed in their seats, discussing the plot.
meanings.sent3: The snowman outstayed in the yard, slowly melting under the warm sun.
meanings.sent4: The old tree outstaying in the forest, witnessing generations come and go.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of coffee outstaying in the cafe, inviting passersby to come in.
